title: When running batches, check any required fields
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user with permissions to run batches is logged in
AND user is attempting to run ANY EBIS batch from the batches screen
AND user has left one or more required fields blank
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks run
custom_expected: THEN system should check required fields and fire appropriate errors for missed fields

title: As a user I want Service milestones projections to populate outside of the season
custom_preconds: GIVEN it is currently the off-season (based on EBIS system dates)
custom_steps: WHEN user views service milestone dates on a pro player profile
custom_expected:
THEN the service milestone dates should be projected by the system even during the offseason. (note that this still won't work until the start of the next calendar year(2019))
AND the MJ Service Change report should similarly work prior to the start of the season (should come along for the ride with the change to the date calculation)
NOTE:
*Currently, the dates are only projected once the season starts, but we should be able to utilize system dates to project these dates even outside of the season. *

title: As a user I would like to NOT get kicked out of EBIS when OKTA fails
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged into EBIS
custom_steps: WHEN there is any kind of OKTA failure
custom_expected:
THEN user should not get kicked out of EBIS
NOTE:
*This is especially relevant to the public events such as the draft. We would like to NOT have sessions kick users out in case of any issues*

title: EBIS UI updates as a result of the new MLB logo and colors

custom_steps: WHEN user views the MLB logo anywhere on the EBIS UI
custom_expected:
THEN the color blue of the MLB bar on the login screen should be updated to MLB Navy: #041e42
AND the MLB logo on the login should be updated to the attached (best-apps.png)
AND the MLB logo used within the app (player headers, etc.) should be updated to the attached(mlb-1024x1024.png)
AND the background color of the Day of Season Info Bar should be updated to MLB Navy: #041e42

title: As a user I want the latest reinstatement date calculated correctly on the Inactive List widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=players_on_inactive_list
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Players+on+Inactive+List+widget
GIVEN a user with perms for the Inactive List Widget is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Inactive List Widget
custom_expected:
THEN Latest Reinstatement Date should be blank for all placement types except for Bereavement List and Paternity List
AND Latest Reinstatement Date for these two placement types should match the one displayed on the actual transaction

title: As a user I want the earliest reinstatement date calculated correctly on the Inactive List widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=players_on_inactive_list
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Players+on+Inactive+List+widget
GIVEN a user with perms for the Inactive List Widget is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Inactive List Widget
custom_expected:
THEN Earliest Reinstatement Date should be properly calculated and displayed for each player that appears on the Inactive List widget per the provided data discovery
AND for those placement types that rely on system dates or schedule information being available, the entire widget should not error out if a date or information is missing. The individual reinstatement date can display NULL or blank or an error code or something, but the other rows and the remainder of the widget should not be affected
AND dates that are calculated using schedule information should appear in italics
*Note that some MJ and MN reinstatement dates are calculated differently for the same placement type*

title: As a user I want the system to calculate the Games Played on the Inactive List correctly
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=players_on_inactive_list
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Players+on+Inactive+List+widget
GIVEN a user with perms for the Inactive List Widget is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Inactive List Widget
custom_expected:
THEN the Games Played column should be populated with the number of games that the player's Club has been scheduled to play since the transaction date
AND the games played should include any games that occurred on the actual placement date, as well as any games scheduled for the current date

title: As a BOC user I want to view the Inactive List widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=players_on_inactive_list
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Players+on+Inactive+List+widget
GIVEN a user with perms for Inactive List Widget is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user hovers their cursor over "Transactions" on the LeftNav
custom_expected:
THEN Disabled List/Rehab tab under Transactions should be renamed "Injured/Inactive/Rehab"
AND browser tab text should be changed to "Injured/Inactive/Rehab"
AND on the tab there should be a "Players on Inactive List" widget beneath the IL and Rehab widgets
AND the widget should match the provided data discovery and wireframe
AND the population of the widget should be every player in the system that is currently on the Inactive List EXCEPT for those on the Deceased List (Note that this should include Restricted/Assigned and Suspended/Assigned players)
AND by default the widget should only show players that have been placed on the Inactive List in the past calendar year (using transaction date)
AND users should be able to view players placed on the Inactive List prior to a year ago using a filter under the filter icon
AND BOC Users should be able to filter the widget down by Org using a filter under the filter icon
AND the "Type" filter and "Level" filters should be available and work
AND default widget export and filters should work

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to indicate that an Inactive List placement should void a player's Addendum C
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user with perms for Inactive List Placement transactions is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to create a player on the Restricted List or Suspended List
custom_expected:
THEN on a MN Place on Restricted List placement there should be a checkbox where the BOC can indicate that the player's Addendum C should be voided
BUT club users should not be able to edit this field
AND if the MN Place on Restricted List placement Reason is set to 'Leave without permission' or 'Failure to report within 10 days of season opening' or 'Failure to submit Voluntarily Retired Letter' then the checkbox should be checked by default
AND if the checkbox is checked at the time of approval then the player's Addendum C should be voided for the year AND the player's MN Contract Year should be invalidated. (the year is defined as R5 date to R5 date)
AND on a MN Place on Suspended List placement there should be a checkbox where the BOC can indicate that the player's Addendum C should be voided
BUT club users should not be able to edit this field
AND if the MN Place on Suspended List placement Reason is set to 'Leave Without Permission' then the checkbox should be checked by default. 
AND reversing either transaction should undo the invalidation and Add C void
AND (for both transactions)the comments associated with the year in the MN Contract/Service Year widget should populate with "Placement Type - Reason - mm/dd/yyyy" Ex: "Restricted List - Leave Without Permission - 10/23/2018". If comments already existed, system should append these
AND this checkbox should be retroactively populated on existing MN Place on Restricted List and MN Place on Suspended Lists with the above reasons

title: As a Club user I want to view the Inactive List widget
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=players_on_inactive_list
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Players+on+Inactive+List+widget
GIVEN a club user with perms for the Inactive List Widget is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user hovers over "Transactions" on the left nav
custom_expected:
THEN the Disabled List/Rehab tab under Transactions should be renamed "Injured/Inactive/Rehab"
AND on the tab there should be a "Players on Inactive List" widget beneath the IL and Rehab widgets
AND the widget should match the provided data discovery and wireframe
AND the population of the widget should be every player on the viewing user's Org that is currently on the Inactive List EXCEPT for those on the Deceased List (Note that this should include Restricted/Assigned and Suspended/Assigned players)
AND by default the widget should only show players that have been placed on the Inactive List in the past calendar year (using transaction date)
AND users should be able to view players placed on the Inactive List prior to a year ago using a filter under the filter icon
AND club Users should not be able to view other Club's Inactive List players in this widget
AND the "Type" filter and "Level" filters should be available and work
AND default widget export and filters should work

title: Inactive List widget - Permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
AND a new permission has been created for the Inactive List widget
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with the Inactive List Widget
custom_expected:
THEN users with this permission should see the Injured/Inactive/Rehab tab under the Transactions dashboard
AND users with this permission see the Players on Inactive List widget on the tab
BUT users without this permission should not see the Players on Inactive List widget

title: As a User, I want to View the Translator Utility widget
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=translators
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Translator+Utility
GIVEN a user with perms for the Translator Utility Widget is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to navigate to the Translator Utility Widget
custom_expected:
THEN on the Employees tab of the Rosters dashboard, there should be a "Translator Utility" widget
AND the widget should be located at the bottom of the tab, below the Employee Contracts widget
AND the widget should match the provided wire and data discovery
AND export to excel should work
AND filters and sorting should be retained

title: As a User, I want to Edit the Translator Utility widget
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=add_translator
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Translator+Utility
GIVEN a user with edit perms for the Translator Utility Widget is logged in
AND user has navigated to the Translator Utility Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to edit the widget
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a Pencil icon on each row of the widget
AND clicking the icon should put the row into edit mode
AND for users with appropriate permissions, there should be an Add Translator button at the bottom of the widget
AND clicking the Add Translator button should add a row to the widget
AND the new row should be editable by the user
AND club users should only be able to edit their own translators

title: As a User, I want to Save the Translator Utility widget
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=add_translator
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Translator+Utility
GIVEN a user with edit/save perms for the Translator Utility Widget is logged in
AND user has navigated to the widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the pencil icon to move any of the rows in the Translator Utility into Edit Mode
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a Save button
AND clicking save should store the current values and the widget should reload with all rows in view mode
AND after a successful save the system should display a successful save blue notification
AND the next time the widget is loaded, the saved values should be displayed

title: As a User, I want to Cancel All Changes to the Translator Utility widget
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=add_translator
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Translator+Utility
GIVEN a user with edit/save perms for the Translator Utility Widget is logged in
AND user has navigated to the widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the pencil icon to move any of the rows in the Translator Utility into Edit Mode
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a Cancel All Changes button
AND clicking Cancel All Changes should discard all changes made to the widget
AND the widget should reload the with all rows in view mode

title: As a User, I want to Delete a row from the Translator Utility widget
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=translators
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=delete
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Translator+Utility
GIVEN a user with delete perms for the Translator Utility Widget is logged in
AND user has navigated to the widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the pencil icon to move any of the rows into edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a trash can icon in each row in the Translator Utility widget
AND clicking the icon should prompt the user to confirm they wish to remove the row
AND if they confirm the decision, the row should be cleared from the widget
BUT if they do not confirm the decision, the user should be returned to the widget and no action should be taken
AND if the user deletes a row that has never been saved, there should be no confirmation message

title: As a User, I want the Translator Utility to roll over to the next year
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=translators
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Translator+Utility
GIVEN a BOC user with perms for initializing the Translator Utility is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user navigates to the widget
custom_expected:
THEN there should be an "Initialize" button on the widget for BOC Users only
AND on the day after the Last Game of World Series system date, the button should become active
AND clicking the button should add a new year to the Year dropdown on the Translator Utility
AND the widget should now default to the new year
AND the previous year's data should be carried forward to the new year

title: As a BOC User, I don't want Club users to be able to edit the Translator Utility widget during the season
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=club_-_post_opening_day
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Translator+Utility
GIVEN a club user with perms for the Translator Utility is logged in 
AND current date is during the season (based on system dates, see below)
custom_steps: WHEN club user navigates to the widget
custom_expected:
THEN on the Opening Day system date, the Translator Utility should become locked to Club users and they should no longer be able to make edits
AND club users should no longer see the Pencil icon, Trash Can icon, or Add Translator button
AND orange text reading "For changes, please contact BOC" should be displayed in the button's place, as depicted in the wire
BUT BOC Users should continue to be able to make edits to the Utility after Opening Day

AND the day after the Last Game of World Series system date, the Utility should become editable to Club Users again
AND the Pencil icon, Trash Can icon, or Add Translator button should reappear for Club Users
AND the orange text should no longer appear

**Note: We should use the overall Opening Day system date, not the individual club season dates**

title: Translator Utility Permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the following LDAP groups and Role assignments have been setup in EBIS:
**New LDAP Groups:
ebis-widget-translatorutility-viewers
ebis-widget-translatorutility-editors

Role Assignments:
ebis-widget-translatorutility-viewers
 ebis-proplayer-boc-viewer-role
 ebis-proplayer-club-viewer-role

ebis-widget-translatorutility-editors
 ebis-proplayer-boc-admin-role
 ebis-proplayer-club-admin-role**
custom_steps: WHEN a user with one of these roles or LDAPs logs in
custom_expected: THEN user should be able to either view or edit based on which LDAP/role they have

title: As a user I want to see payment information on a Rule 5 Selection
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=rule_5_selection
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rule+5+Selection+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a club or BOC user with edit perms for Rule 5 Selection transaction is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user creates or is viewing a NEW Rule 5 Selection Transaction
custom_expected:
THEN for all newly created Rule 5 Selection transactions there should be two new fields available and visible on the form:
  - Payment Due Date
  - Paid Date
AND payment Due should be equal to the selection date and uneditable
AND paid Date should be an editable date field and should be editable post approval by the BOC and the involved Club
BUT these fields should NOT display on previous Rule 5 Selections

title: As a user I want to see payment information on a Return of Rule 5 Selection
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=club_accepts_-_return_of_rule_5_selection_submitte
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Return+of+Rule+5+Selection
GIVEN a club or BOC user with edit perms for a Return of Rule 5 Selection transaction is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user creates or is viewing a NEW Return of Rule 5 Selection transaction for an ACCEPTED Rule 6 Return
custom_expected:
THEN for all newly created Return of Rule 5 Selection transactions for ACCEPTED Rule 6 Returns, there should two new fields available and visible on the form:
  - Payment Due Date
  - Paid Date
AND payment Due should be equal to the selection date and should be uneditable
AND paid Date should be an editable date field and should be editable post approval by the BOC and the involved Clubs
BUT these fields should NOT display on previous Return of Rule 5 Selections, **or new Return of Rule 5 Selections for REJECTED Rule 6 Returns**
AND "Assignment Agreement" should also be an available label for the transaction, and a file attachment label should be required if a file is attached

title: As a user I want to export the Payment Transactions screen
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user with perms for the Payment Transactions screen is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Payment Transactions screen
custom_expected:
THEN user should see an "Export" button when viewing the Transaction Payments utility
AND clicking Export should download an xls of the data currently displayed on the screen (including any applied filters)

title: As a user I want the Transaction Payments screen to have the correct population of transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user with perms for the Transaction Payments screen is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user views the Transaction Payments screen
custom_expected:
THEN a transaction should appear in the Transaction Payment screen if the transaction is an Outright Trade, Waiver Claim Assignment, Rule 5 Selection or Return of Rule 5 Selection AND any of the following are true: 
 - The transaction has at least one Payment Due that has not yet been marked paid.
 - The transaction has an Assignment Agreement required that has not yet been uploaded.
 - The transaction has at least one PTBNL that has not yet been named OR paid.
 - The transaction has at least one PTBNL Assignment Agreement that has not yet been uploaded.
AND the transaction should appear in the appropriate Org(s) section of the utility. (Note that the same transaction might appear in multiple places to cover all outgoing and incoming payments and PTBNL due)
AND the Payments due dates and amounts listed should match those on the transaction itself, including any included Payment schedules
AND the payments due should appear in the appropriate colors
AND the transaction should appropriately roll off when None of the above criteria are met for the transaction anymore

*Note that ALL historical Rule 5 Selections and Return of Rule 5 Selections need to be omitted from this utility, despite the fact that some of them might not have Assignment Agreements and none will have paid dates*

title: As a user I want to receive a notification when a Payment is due if not marked paid
custom_preconds:
Clipboard:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/MJA+Notifications
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
AND a payment on an Outright Trade or Waiver Claim Assignment is due that has not yet been marked paid
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the nightly notification batch
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate Notification #11 for Club and BOC MJ Transaction Admins
BUT a notification should ONLY be generated for an outstanding payment one time (i.e. if user runs the batch again it shouldn't generate an additional notif for the same payment)

title: As a user I do not want to see extremely old transactions on the Transaction Payments screen
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user with perms for the Transaction Payments screen is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Transaction Payments screen
custom_expected:
THEN data for older trades should be adjusted so that they don't appear anymore (see attached story for logic)
AND ALL of the ones done in ebis1 should be removed from this utility. (Date of around 1/31/2017 or earlier)

title: As a BOC user I want to view the Transaction Payments screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_waiver_claim_payments_-_boc
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Transaction+Payments
GIVEN a BOC user with perms for the Transaction Payments screen is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user attempts to navigate to the Transaction Payments Screen
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a new "Transaction Payments" tab under the Transactions dashboard
AND browser tab text should be "Transaction Payments"
AND clicking on Transaction Payments should load the screen per the wireframe and the data discovery

title: As a Club user I want to view the Transaction Payments screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://t4lvuq.axshare.com/#p=trade_waiver_claim_payments_-_club
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Transaction+Payments
GIVEN a club user with perms for the Transaction Payments screen is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to navigate to the Transaction Payments screen
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a new "Transaction Payments" tab under the Transactions dashboard
AND clicking on Transaction Payments should load the screen per the wireframe and the data discovery
AND the utility should contain only those transactions that should be displayed for the viewing Org on the Outgoing and Incoming pages
AND the Club user should be unable to view other Org's transactions in this utility, unless they are either receiving or giving a payment

title: Transaction Payments - Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a new permission has been created to control access to the Transaction Payments utility
custom_steps: WHEN user with this permission logs in
custom_expected:
THEN user should see the "Transactions" menu on the left nav and the "Transaction Payments" tab under the Transactions dashboard. 
AND user should also be able to load and view the utility 
BUT users without the permission should NOT see the Transaction Payments tab or the utility

title: As a user I want to see different LOP columns on the PIEF List that are determined by their stats and not which LOP they ended the season on
custom_preconds:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_club
GIVEN a user with permission to view PIEF list is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user views the PIEF List
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a Level of Play column. (Before, that was displaying the level of play that the player is on at the time he is added to the PIEF List)
AND the old Level of Play column, should be replaced with 4 new columns
AND the system should display a YYYY LOP by G column with YYYY replaced with the current year
AND the system should display a YYYY LOP by IP column with YYYY replaced with the current year
AND the system should display a YYYY LOP by G column with YYYY replaced with the prior calendar year
AND the system should display a YYYY LOP by IP column with YYYY replaced with the prior calendar year
AND each of these columns should be populated for pitchers only
AND all of these columns should lock in at the time the PIEF List is marked Reviewed

**Example explanation: 
Level of play is the level at which a player accrued at least 50% of total stats counting down from the MLB (MJ) level.

Player A

MLB: 20 Innings Pitched
AAA: 15 Innings Pitched
AA: 25 Innings Pitched
 
In the example above, Player A is a AAA player.  He pitched 60 total innings, and counting down from the top, at MLB he pitched 20/60 or 33%, that doesn't total at least 50%, so we go to next level.  Counting MLB and AAA he pitched 35/60 or 58%.  Even though he pitched most of his innings at AA, he reached the 50% threshold at AAA so that's his level.**

title: PIEF List's stat comparison should use calculated LOP to determine if they have met the threshold for the PIEF List rather than the LOP they ended the season at
custom_preconds:
GIVEN previously, the flag that appears on the PIEF List indicating that a player does not meet the criteria for Extreme Fatigue was based on the player's actual level of play, rather than the calculated value.
AND previously, this was ALSO true for those checks where the player's stats are compared to the prior year
AND a user with PIEF list perms is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user views the PIEF list
custom_expected:
THEN the flag should be updated to use the player's calculated LOP based on the stats earned
BUT the remainder of the logic should work the same as outlined in the original story https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/153201633

title: As a user I want the MN Contract Years batch to determine which years each player earned a Contract Year for
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user with permission to run the MN Contract Years batch is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the MN Contract Years Batch
custom_expected:
THEN  the batch should be updated to have a "from beginning of time" mode
AND running it in that mode should allow us to determine the specific years that each player has earned a MN Contract Year during their career
AND this batch should populate the MN Contract/Service Years widget for each player
AND a year should be added to the widget for each year that the player appeared on either a MJ or MN Roster at any point during the year (need to take into account the 2+ year on an IL requirement that hides these players from rosters)
AND if the player earned a contract year for the year, a checkmark should display
BUT if the player did not earn a contract year for the year, no checkmark should display

title: As a user I want the MN Contract Years batch to determine when a player has earned a MN Contract Year for the current year
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user with permissions to run the MN Contract Years Batch is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the MN Contract Years Batch
custom_expected:
THEN the batch should be updated to check each player that is on a MJ or MN Roster each night to determine if they should have a contract year for the current year
AND if the player appears on a roster and they do not yet have the current year in the MN Contract/Service Years widget, system should add it
AND they should earn a year if they appeared on a MN Roster with an Active or DL roster status during the season, regardless of if they have a MN Contract for the year or an Addendum C
AND the MN Contract Year batch should ignore any players for which the Contract Year has already been invalidated (either manually or via IL placement)

title: As a user I want the MN Service Years batch to determine which years each player earned a Service Year for
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user with perms to run the MN Service Years Batch is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the MN Service Years Batch
custom_expected:
THEN the batch should be updated to have a "from beginning of time" mode
AND running the batch in that mode should allow us to determine the specific years that each player has earned a MN Service Year during their career 
AND this batch should populate the MN Contract/Service Years widget for each player
AND if the player earned a DSL/VSL MN Service year for the year, a checkmark should display in that column
BUT if the player did not earn a service year for the year, no checkmark should display
AND if the player earned a non-DSL/VSL MN Service year for the year, a checkmark should display in that column
BUT if the player did not earn a service year for the year, no checkmark should display

title: As a user I want the Potential Minor League Free Agent Year batch to look at the number of MN Contract Years a player has earned instead of the number of Addendum Cs
custom_preconds:
Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Potential+MnFA+Year+Batch
GIVEN a BOC user with perms to run the Potential Minor League Free Agent Year Batch is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the Potential MNFA Year Batch
custom_expected:
THEN the batch should be updated so that instead of checking the number of C's a player has had associated with their current MN Contract, it is looking at the number of Contract Years that have been earned while on their current contract
AND all of the batch rules as laid out should still work, including the setting of the year on the player's Pro Player Profile
AND in addition to the above changes we also need to begin calculating this year for players who are in the last year of their MJ Contract, regardless of if they have a MN Contract or not(see attached rules)

title: As a user I want the Nightly Minor League Free Agent batch to look at the number of MN Contract Years a player has earned instead of the number of Addendum Cs
custom_preconds:
Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Nightly+Potential+Free+Agent+Batch
GIVEN a user with perms to run the Nightly MNFA batch is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the Nightly MNFA batch
custom_expected:
THEN the batch should be updated so that instead of checking the number of C's a player has had associated with their current MN Contract, it is looking at the number of Contract Years that have been earned while on their current contract
AND all of the batch rules as laid out should still work, including the setting of the flag on the player's Pro Player Profile

title: As a user I want to see the MN Contract/Service Years widget on Professional Player Profiles
custom_preconds:
Wireframe: 
https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Service tab of a Pro Player Profile
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a "MN Contract/Service Years"  widget at the bottom
AND the widget should match the provided wireframe

title: As a BOC user I want to edit the MN Contract/Service Years widget on Professional Player Profiles
custom_preconds:
Wireframe: 
https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service
GIVEN a BOC user with edit perms for Pro Player Profiles is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the MN Contract/Service Years widget on a Pro Player Profile
custom_expected:
THEN there should be pencil icons available for each row
AND clicking the pencil icon should place the selected row into edit mode
AND the user should have the ability to edit the MN Contract Years column for each year to designate whether the player earned the year, did not earn it, or should have the year invalidated
AND comments should be required for any year that they invalidate
AND options in the dropdown should be "Earned" "Not Earned" and "Invalidated"

title: As a user I want to indicate in the system which historical years a player's MN Contract Year was invalidated
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* After #161005202 has been delivered and the batch run, a script needs to be constructed and run to mark the historical years that were "invalidated".
* To be considered invalidated, the system must find a specific Inactive List transaction for the year. (See Below)
* Regardless of if the player would have earned a contract year or not, if one of the below IL placements is found for a year, display a red X for the year. 
* The cutoff date for a year is the Rule 5 Draft. 

Inactive List transactions: 
* Minor League Restricted List with reasons of : 
  1. Leave without permission 
  2. Failure to report within 10 days of season opening
  3. Failure to submit Voluntarily Retired Letter 
* Minor League Suspended List transaction with reasons of: 
  1. Leave without permission
* Place on Voluntarily Retired list

title: As a BOC user I want voiding a player's MN Contract to uncheck the player's MN Contract Year if it's the only one
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Voiding a player's MN contract should re-run the MN Contract Years batch "from the beginning of time" batch on the player to determine if any of the players MN Contract Years need to be removed.
* If the player should have any of their MN Contract years removed as a result of the void, it is appropriately reflected in the player's MN Contract/Service Years widget.

title: As a user I want the MN Contract Years and Service Years values on the player's profile to be the sum of the years displayed in the MN Contract/Service Years widget
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* The MN Contract Years value on the player's profile is set to the sum total of the years marked with a checkmark for MN Contract Year in the MN Contract/Service Years widget.
* The MN Service Years value on the player's profile is set to the sum total of the years marked with a checkmark for MN Service Year displayed in the MN Contract/Service Years widget.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to indicate that an Inactive List placement should void a player's Addendum C
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* On a MN Place on Restricted List placement there is a checkbox where the BOC can indicate that the player's Addendum C should be voided. Club users are not able to edit this field.
* If the MN Place on Restricted List placement Reason is set to 'Leave without permission' or 'Failure to report within 10 days of season opening' or 'Failure to submit Voluntarily Retired Letter' then the checkbox should be checked by default. 
* If the checkbox is checked at the time of approval then the player's Addendum C should be voided for the year AND the player's MN Contract Year should be invalidated. (the year is defined as R5 date to R5 date)
* On a MN Place on Suspended List placement there is a checkbox where the BOC can indicate that the player's Addendum C should be voided. Club users are not able to edit this field.
* If the MN Place on Suspended List placement Reason is set to 'Leave Without Permission' then the checkbox should be checked by default. 
* Reversing the transaction should undo the invalidation and Add C void. 
* The comments associated with the year in the MN Contract/Service Year widget should populate with "Placement Type - Reason - mm/dd/yyyy" Ex: "Restricted List - Leave Without Permission - 10/23/2018". If comments already existed, append these.
* Part of this story should be to retroactively populate this checkbox on existing MN Place on Restricted List and MN Place on Suspended Lists with the above reasons. 
* Do a comparison of any guys who have this set and did NOT have his C voided and Contract Year and attach here for review.

title: As a BOC user I want approving a player's Place on Voluntarily Retired list transaction to invalidate their MN Contract Year
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Approving a MN place on Voluntarily Retired list transaction then the player's Addendum C should be voided for the year AND the player's MN Contract Year should be invalidated if it has not already been done so. (the year is defined as R5 date to R5 date)
* The comments associated with the year in the MN Contract/Service Year widget should populate with "Voluntarily Retired - mm/dd/yyyy" with the date being replaced with the transaction date. If comments already existed, append these. 
* Reversing the transaction should undo the invalidation, comments and Add C void.

title: As a user I want to be able to add a Mexican Assignment Agreement to any MN Contract
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When creating any minor contract there is the "Add Section" option. 
* "Mexican Assignment Agreement" is an option under the add section button, in addition to whatever other sections were previously available.
* Selecting "Mexican Assignment Agreement" will add the section to the MNC.
* The user will have the ability to complete the Mexican Assignment Agreement portion of the MN Contract. 
* For International First Year contracts, the mexican assignment agreement's fee paid to the player counts as the player's Signing Bonus (in addition to any signing bonus clause added) .
* For Domestic First Year contracts, the fee paid to the player counts as the player's signing bonus (in addition to any signing bonus clause added).
* Non First Year contracts continue to not appear in either utility. 
* Check to see any places that we need to update the Signing Bonus amount to include the player's fee and the signing bonus amount to display the total like we have been doing for International First Year contracts.

title: As a user I want a player who is Pending Active when they are selected in the R5 Draft to be properly activated when the MNC is approved
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Players who are Pending Active that are selected in the Rule 5 Draft are able to have their MN Contract approved after the draft without receiving an error.
* The player's activation transaction activates the player as of the signing date(?), despite the presence of the Rule 5 Selection.
* If any other transactions are present for the player between the signing date and the approval of the MNC, the user should still be stopped by the transaction ordering rule.

title: As a user I want to be able to add an Addendum G to an Addendum C
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://f2j41d.axshare.com/#p=add_addendum_g

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a user is creating or editing an Addendum C via the Single C form (not the widget), there is now an "Add Section" button available that allows the user to select to add an Addendum G to the Addendum C form.
* Selecting "Addendum G" from the Add Section button will add an Addendum G to the single C. 
* The user will have the ability to remove the added G using the trash can icon. 
* Once the Addendum G has been added, it is no longer displayed as an option under the Add Section button. 
* If there are no more options available under "Add Section", hide the button. 
* The Addendum C should still be able to go through the standard workflow.

title: As a user I want to be able to add an Addendum F to an Addendum C
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://f2j41d.axshare.com/#p=add_addendum_f

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a user is creating or editing an Addendum C via the Single C form (not the widget), there is now an "Add Section" button available that allows the user to select to add an Addendum F to the Addendum C form.
* Selecting "Addendum F" from the Add Section button will add an Addendum F to the single C. 
* If an Addendum F is present, then the state selection is required. 
* The user will have the ability to remove the added F using the trash can icon. 
* Once the Addendum F has been added, it is no longer displayed as an option under the Add Section button. 
* If there are no more options available under "Add Section", hide the button. 
* The Addendum C should still be able to go through the standard workflow.

title: As a user I want to see a Flag on the Contract History if an Addendum C has an F or G added
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When an Addendum C appears in a player's Contract History, if an F or G has been added to the Addendum C, display a checkmark in the appropriate column.

title: As a user I want clicking "Print" on an Addendum C to print the Addendum F if it is included
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Print" from the Single C form will print the Single C and then the Addendum F in one pdf. The Addendum F is the same as it is in a printed MN Contract. 
* The Authorized Signatory information printed should match that of the Add C. 
* For now we are only doing English. 
* The Location signed fields printed on the Addendum F should be prepopulated with the values entered on the C.

title: As a user I want clicking "Print" on an Addendum C to print the Addendum G if it is included
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Print" from the Single C form will print the Single C and then the Addendum G in one pdf if the G is included with the C. The Addendum G should match what it does on the MN Contract.
* The Authorized Signatory information printed should match that of the Add C. 
* For now we are only doing English. 
* The Location signed fields printed on the Addendum G should be prepopulated with the values entered on the C.

title: As a BOC user I want to see a flag on the Approvals Clipboard if an Addendum C has an Addendum F or Addendum G included
custom_steps:
Flags:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/22.+Addendum+C+Flags

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If an Addendum C has an Addendum F attached to it, there is a flag for the Add C on the Approvals widget. See Flags #22.6.
* If an Addendum C has an Addendum G attached to it, there is a flag for the Add C on the Approvals widget. See Flags #22.7.

title: As a Club user I want to see the Addendum F and Addendum G information on the Multi-C widget
custom_steps:
Wires: 
https://f2j41d.axshare.com/#p=add_f_and_g

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is an "Add F" column added to the Addendum C widget for Club users.
* There is an "Add G" column added to the Addendum C widget for Club users. 
* The Add F column shows the state selected in view mode if the Add F is included in the Addendum C. 
* In edit mode, the Add F provides the option to check that an Add F should be included in the Add C and also to select the state. 
* In edit mode, the Add G column provides the option to check to include the Add G. 
* On 'Tender' the State field should be checked as a required field if the Add F is included.

title: As a BOC user I want to see the Addendum F and G information on the Multi-C widget
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://f2j41d.axshare.com/#p=boc_-_view_add_cs

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is an "Add F" column added to the Addendum C widget for BOC users.
* There is an "Add G" column added to the Addendum C widget for BOC users. 
* The Add F column shows the state selected in view mode if the Add F is included in the Addendum C. 
* In edit mode, the Add F provides the option to check that an Add F should be included in the Add C and also to select the state. 
* In edit mode, the Add G column provides the option to check to include the Add G. 
* On 'Approve' the State field should be checked as a required field if the Add F is included.

title: As a Club user I want to apply a Club Signature stamp to an Addendum C that includes an Addendum F
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When an Addendum C that contains an Addendum F has been fully signed by the player, it appears in the Club Signature widget.
* Clicking "Stamp Signature" with an Addendum C selected that contains an Addendum F should apply the Club Signatory's signature in BOTH of the places required, as well as populate the date signed for the Club Signatory in both of the required date fields. 
* Once the Club Signature's stamps have been appropriately applied, the attachment is present on the Addendum C with the file label of Addendum C. 
* The Addendum C is appropriately submitted to the BOC for approval just as though the Addendum C did not contain the F. Because the F will trigger a flag, this will never be auto-approved. 
* The BOC user should be able to approve the Addendum C and the approval stamp should be applied to the bottom of the pdf.

title: As a Club user I want to apply a Club Signature stamp to an Addendum C that includes an Addendum G
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When an Addendum C that contains an Addendum G has been fully signed by the player, it appears in the Club Signature widget.
* Clicking "Stamp Signature" with an Addendum C selected that contains an Addendum G should apply the Club Signatory's signature in BOTH of the places required, as well as populate the date signed for the Club Signatory in both of the required date fields. 
* Once the Club Signature's stamps have been appropriately applied, the attachment is present on the Addendum C with the file label of Addendum C. 
* The Addendum C is appropriately submitted to the BOC for approval just as though the Addendum C did not contain the G. Because the G will trigger a flag, this will never be auto-approved. 
* The BOC user should be able to approve the Addendum C and the approval stamp should be applied to the bottom of the pdf.

title: As a Club user I want to apply a Club Signature stamp to an Addendum C that includes an Addendum F and an Addendum G
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When an Addendum C that contains an Addendum F and G has been fully signed by the player, it appears in the Club Signature widget.
* Clicking "Stamp Signature" with an Addendum C selected that contains an Addendum F and Addendum G should apply the Club Signatory's signature in ALL THREE of the places required, as well as populate the date signed for the Club Signatory in the required date fields. 
* Once the Club Signature's stamps have been appropriately applied, the attachment is present on the Addendum C with the file label of Addendum C. 
* The Addendum C is appropriately submitted to the BOC for approval just as though the Addendum C did not contain the G. Because the F and G will trigger a flag, this will never be auto-approved. 
* The BOC user should be able to approve the Addendum C and the approval stamp should be applied to the bottom of the pdf.

title: As a user, I want the existing esign disclaimer found on Addendum Cs and NODs to also appear on the new F & G Pages
custom_steps:
The disclaimer is as follows:
"By providing my electronic signature and selecting the Submit button below, I accept these terms and conditions as if physically signed by me in writing."

title: As a Club user I want Printing from the Multi-C widget to print the F and G where necessary
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a user prints an Addendum C from the Multi-C widget that has an Addendum F or G added (or both), the system will print all of the relevant addendums.

title: As a user I do not want to be able to send an Addendum C for e-sig if a country other than the United States is selected for location signed
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* There should be a rule check added to sending an Addendum C for e-signature that if the location signed is set to anything other than United States, the user gets a hard error. 
* The error should read "E-signature is not supported outside of the United States."

title: As a Club user I want the player to be able to e-sign an Addendum C that includes an Addendum F
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Sending an Addendum C for e-signature that contains an Addendum F will appropriately generate the Addendum C and Addendum F and be available in the Player Signature widget, and also available for signature from the Addendum C. (like it is now)
* When the player goes to sign the Addendum C now, there will be two places the player is required to Sign.
* The Date field will be populated on the Addendum C as well as the Addendum F.
* The document will not be considered fully signed by the player until both the F and C are signed.

title: As a Club user I want the player to be able to e-sign an Addendum C that includes an Addendum G
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Sending an Addendum C for e-signature that contains an Addendum G will appropriately generate the Addendum C and Addendum G and be available in the Player Signature widget, and also available for signature from the Addendum C. (like it is now)
* When the player goes to sign the Addendum C now, there will be two places the player is required to Sign.
* The Date field will be populated on the Addendum C as well as the Addendum G.
* The document will not be considered fully signed by the player until both the G and C are signed.

title: As a Club user I want the player to be able to e-sign an Addendum C that includes an Addendum F and an Addendum G
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Sending an Addendum C for e-signature that contains an Addendum F and G will appropriately generate the Addendum C, F and G and be available in the Player Signature widget, and also available for signature from the Addendum C. (like it is now)
* When the player goes to sign the Addendum C now, there will be three places the player is required to Sign.
* The Date field will be populated on the Addendum C as well as the Addendum F and Addendum G.
* The document will not be considered fully signed by the player until the F, G and C are signed.

title: As a user I want to be able to add a player to the Minor League Insurance utility that is no longer appearing in quick search
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When adding a new player to the Minor League Insurance utility, users need to be able to add players that no longer appear on printed rosters, but are still affiliated with their Organization (Players that have been on the IL for 2+ years). The player field needs to be updated to pull in the players that have been on the IL for 2+ years in addition to those that appear in our regular quicksearch. Players on the Voluntarily Retired list for 2+ years and all on the Deceased List are excluded.

title: As a BOC user I want to see a flag on my approvals widget if an MNC contains a CEP package valued at greater than $200K
custom_steps:
Rules #5.61:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Minor+Contract+-+onSubmit

Messages #56:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Minor+Contracts+-+Messages

Flags #8.18:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/8.+Flags

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On "Submit Terms" and any other state change that on Submit rules are checked, check to see if the Minor Contract contains a CEP clause. 
* If yes, and the total value of the clause exceeds $200,000 (Living + Tuition), show Messages #56. 
* This should always be overrideable for both BOC and Clubs. 
* The BOC should see this as a flag on their Approvals Clipboard.

title: As a user I want re-signing a player with a lapsed CSP or CEP clause to re-activate their CSP or CEP
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a player has a CSP or CEP with a "Lapsed" status due to 2 years having passed since they were last active with MLB, the CSP or CEP needs to be moved back to the appropriate "Current" status. (Either Current, Current - Living Allowance Only or Current - Tuition Allowance Only, based on the money left for the CSP/CEP).

title: As a user I want the list of available system dates to be able to differ by year
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* For 2019 and on we only want to have 3 waiver period dates, but all 5 waiver periods should appear when viewing prior year's in the System Dates screen. 
* This change should allow us to have other system dates that only begin appearing in the year they are added, rather than existing for prior years by default. 



From nancy's JIRA - https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-14214

title: As a user I want the waiver bulletin process to correctly use the new waiver system dates
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* For 2019 and on we only want to have 3 waiver period dates, but all 5 waiver periods should appear when viewing prior year's in the System Dates screen. 
* When the Waiver Result bulletin is created, any players that have Waivers requested that do not yet have a result, and have NOT been claimed or had their waivers cancelled have their Result set according to the following criteria:
  * For UR waivers, set result text to "Secured for the purposes of UR".
  * For all other waivers, set result text to "Secured until {Waiver Claim Expiration Date}"
* Waiver Claim Expiration Date should be formatted as Secured until [Sun] [Jan] [10], [13]:00 ET [2014], except for in the case of "Midnight", which should be spelled out in place of the time (Ex: Secured until [Sun] [Jan] [10], Midnight ET [2014].)
* The Waiver Claim Expiration Date is determined by the following steps:
  * Determine the waiver period end date based on waiver type
  * Default waiver expiration date to 5pm on waiver period end
  * Handle special cases:
 - if player is optioned, update waiver expiration date to 1pm on the 3rd calendar day after the claim expiration date, unless that falls after the end of the waiver period
 - Else for outright waivers where the claim expiration date was in the 1st, outright waiver period, update waiver expiration date to 1pm on the 7th calendar day after the claim expiration date, unless that falls after the end of the waiver period.
 - Else for trade waivers, update waiver expiration date to date and time specified in system dates. 
  * For outright waivers with a claim expiration date in the 3rd outright waiver period, if the player is not Optioned, set the time in the result message to Midnight instead of whatever time was determined above

title: Temporary Mapping of winter league clubs to current MN Clubs for stats
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* In order to test the Club Communication portion of the system, we need to fake the stats of the clubs.
* Use the provided spreadsheet to map the WL Clubs to the MN Clubs for stats purposes. 

*Note that not every Club is mapped*

title: As a WLP user I want to be able to tell if a player's report summary has been completed by the color of the button
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When looking at a Report Summary, the "Edit Report" or "View Report" button is blue if the underlying report has been completed for the relevant player.
* This also works when viewing the form in Spanish.

title: As a WLP user I want Prior Season Import Requests to expire on a specific date
custom_steps:
Business Driver: 
* When a Winter League Request reaches the In Negotiation state, the BOC and the WL Team both see a countdown until the request expires. There is a new requirement that those requests that are a result of appearing as an Import player on a Reserve List expire based off of a system date rather than a set number of days*

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a new system date added "Prior Season Import Requests Expire".
* The Winter League Requests that are generated from an Import Request count down from this system date when they reach the In Negotiation status rather than the standard 11 days that all of the other In Negotiation requests use. 
* Non prior season import requests continue to use the 11 day countdown as described in the original story. #154102127 and #154101939
* Once the countdown reaches 0 for both prior season imports or regular winter league requests, the request status is updated to Expired. See #155384824

title: As a WLP user I want mobile friendly buttons when using the app on smaller screens
custom_steps:
**Mockup:**
See attached for how these look in EBIS

**AC:**
- On form pages within WLP mobile buttons should appear at the same screen size as EBIS (I believe we set it at screen sizes under 768px)
- The mobile button container should be pinned to the bottom of the screen, collapsed by default and display a blue arrow.
- Clicking the arrow will expand the mobile buttons and change the direction of the arrow. 
- Remove the MLB logo from the mobile button container currently displaying in WLP (screenshot attached)

title: As a BOC user I want to see an are you sure message when Canceling a request
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* When clicking 'Cancel' on the Requests page the user is prompted to confirm that they wish to cancel the player's request. See Messages #13.
* If the user confirms, the request is cancelled. 
* If the user does not confirm, no action is taken.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to type to filter the Requests page
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_wl_coach

Acceptance Criteria:
* There is a search filter in the filters section of the screen. 
* Typing text in this search box filters the requests currently displayed on the screen. 


Came from https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-15581

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to move a Winter League Request back to Pending from Canceled
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* When the BOC is viewing a Canceled Request in the WLP Requests screen, there is an option to move the Request back to Pending.
* The user will be able to successfully move the request to Pending. 
* From Pending, the user will be able to successfully move the request to Submitted and run through the workflow as though the request had never been canceled. 
* If the request was previously moved to canceled from a Submitted or In Negotiation state, a new Winter League Request transaction is created when the request is moved back to the Submitted state.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to export the list of Winter League Requests for the current season
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* When a BOC user is viewing the Winter League Requests page, they see an Export button.
* Clicking Export downloads an Excel spreadsheet to the user's computer with a list of the current season's Winter League Requests, including all of the information that is visible to the BOC within the widget, including the entire content of any relevant comments.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reopen multiple report summaries at once
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a checkbox column added to the Club Communications widget for BOC users only.
* The BOC is able to check off one or more reports.
* There is a "Re-Open" button on the widget footer, and it is disabled until at least one report is checked off. 
* Clicking "Re-Open" will reopen the selected report(s). 
* If any reports are selected that are already in a Draft or Pending state, no action is taken.

title: As a BOC User, I want to receive a warning when trying to Approve a Reserve List with Potential Matches
custom_steps:
AC:
 - If a user attempts to approve a Reserve List with Potential Matches, they will be prompted to confirm they wish to continue
 **Title:** Warning
**Body:** The reserve list you are approving contains potential duplicates.
**Hint:** Do you wish to continue?
**Buttons:** Yes, No
  -- If they click 'Yes', the reserve list will be approved
  -- If they click 'No', the modal will be dismissed and the user will return to the unapproved reserve list

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be able to type to filter the Requests page
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_wl_coach


Acceptance Criteria:
* There is a search filter in the filters section of the screen. 
* Typing text in this search box filters the requests currently displayed on the screen. 
* When viewing the page in Spanish it says "Buscar" instead of Search (grey hint text can remain in English).

Came from https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-15581

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see errors if I attempt to close a Player modal without passing the required field/format check
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=inline_validation

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Player+Report+Modals+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user clicks "OK" on the player modal on a Report Summary, the system should run a required field check for the fields displayed on the modal (varies based on the position selected). 
* If any of the required fields are left blank, the system should highlight those fields in red and display an inline error message stating the number of required fields missing. 
* If the modal is for a pitcher, the system should also validate that the value entered for "Count" is equal to or higher than each of the corresponding "Strike" amounts entered. 
* If the modal is for a pitcher, the system should also validate that the value entered for "High Speed" is equal to or higher than that entered for "Avg Speed"
* If either of the above rules are violated, the offending fields are highlighted in red, with the number of invalid values entered reflected in the in-line error message per the wireframe.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see errors if I attempt to close a Player modal without passing the required field/format check (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=inline_validation

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Necessary+Spanish+Translations

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user clicks "OK" on the player modal on a Report Summary, the system should run a required field check for the fields displayed on the modal (varies based on the position selected). 
* If any of the required fields are left blank, the system should highlight those fields in red and display an inline error message stating the number of required fields missing. 
* If the modal is for a pitcher, the system should also validate that the value entered for "Count" is equal to or higher than each of the corresponding "Strike" amounts entered. 
* If the modal is for a pitcher, the system should also validate that the value entered for "High Speed" is equal to or higher than that entered for "Avg Speed"
* If either of the above rules are violated, the offending fields are highlighted in red, with the number of invalid values entered reflected in the in-line error message per the wireframe and provided translations.

title: As a Winter League Club I want to be able to use Business Objects in Spanish
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* The prompts and Business Objects instance for the Winter League Performance Report in the Winter League Portal should display in Spanish if the report is accessed when the user is viewing the application in Spanish.
* It should continue to run/work in English if the report is accessed when the user is viewing the application in English.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to report a game not being listed (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=game_not_listed

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Game+Not+Listed+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League user is looking at the "Club Communication" widget in Spanish, they see a "Juegos No Listado" button. 
* Clicking on the button will open a popup, per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* When the user has entered the required fields, the "Reportar Juego Ausente" button is enabled. 
* Clicking this button will generate an email to ebissupport@mlb.com with the following information: 
 - Username of the user submitting the missing game.
 - Club affiliation of the user submitting the missing game. 
 - All of the information entered on the pop-up.
 - Date/time the missing game is being reported.
 - Environment the report is being sent from. 
* There should also be a "Cancelar" button available. Clicking Cancelar will close the modal without taking any action.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to report a game not being listed
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=game_not_listed

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Game+Not+Listed+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League user is looking at the "Club Communication" widget, they see a "Game Not Listed" button. 
* Clicking on the button will open a popup, per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* When the user has entered the required fields, the "Report Missing Game" button is enabled. 
* Clicking this button will generate an email to ebissupport@mlb.com with the following information: 
 - Username of the user submitting the missing game.
 - Club affiliation of the user submitting the missing game. 
 - All of the information entered on the pop-up.
 - Date/time the missing game is being reported.
 - Environment the report is being sent from. 
* There should also be a "Cancel" button available. Clicking Cancel will close the modal without taking any action. 
* The subject of the email should be "WLP - Missing Game Reported"

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to view the Player Report modal of a Report Summary for a pitcher (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=pos___pitcher

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Player+Report+Modals+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Ver Informe" will appear on the Report Summary screen in view mode when viewing the site in Spanish for any Pitcher that has a completed report. 
* Clicking on "Ver Informe" will launch a modal in view mode in Spanish per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 

*Note that Box Score will be handled in a separate story*

title: As a user I want to see all international first year signings in the bonus utility
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Users have requested that ALL first year international minor contracts appear in the signing bonus utility, instead of just the ones that include a signing bonus clause or mexican assignment agreement. 
* The Signing Bonus amount for any player that is included without any Signing Bonus clause or Mexican Assignment agreement would just be $0, and they would not show as an exception.

title: As a user I want to be able to export all MN Contracts based on Signing Country
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=file_attachments_-_minor_contracts

Acceptance Criteria:
* In addition to the current criteria that the user can input, we need to add a Signing Country field. 
* This should be required and default to "All". All of the countries currently available in the system should be in the dropdown and the user should be able to select multiple countries to run for.

title: As BOC, I want to manually adjust Intl Signing Bonus pool total amounts
custom_steps:
Currently in the Intl Signing Bonus Utility, the bonus pools just have the concept of an "original" flag in them.  This drives the max allowable pool amount - both the value on the UI, as well as underlying rule checks on Trades.  BOC Users would like more control/flexibility in what drives this max allowable pool amount.

1 - Update the system value, go from a percentage to a multiplier.  Currently it is 75 for 2018, it should be 1.75 instead.  Same with the years going forward.
2 - Add a new field to the Signing Bonus Pool section -> *Amount Towards Max* 
    - When we create original pool entries at the beginning of the signing period, we will use the system value associated with the given year to calculate Amount Towards Max.  For example, if the Amount field is $1,000,000, then Amount Towards Max will be $1,750,000 (1,000,000 * 1.75).
    - If a new row is created, and "Original Pool" is checked, we will again drive off of the same system value for the current year.  Currently (in 2018) it is .75.   
    - If a Trade is created, the Amount Towards Max field will be $0.
    - If a manual row is added to the Pool section, Amount Towards Max will be equal to Amount.  So, if the Amount is $1,000,000, Amount Towards Max will be $1,000,000 as well.

3 - This new field will be editable only by BOC users (same as current pool section)
4 - If the Amount field is edited, we should recalculate the Amount Towards Max field, with the same rules as from #2.
5 - We should increase the limit of the Description field up to 200 characters, and allow more room for it on the screen.
6 - The rules that referenced the Maximum Allowable Pool value will now just take the sum of all of the *Amount Towards Max* values from the signing bonus pool section.
7 - The UI will also just take the sum of all of the *Amount Towards Max* values from the signing bonus pool section.
8 - Create a data fix to update the values for *Amount Towards Max* in the existing entries from 2017 and 2018 - so they are equivalent to what we have now in Ebis2.
9 - research when pools are created for first time

Referenced jira:  https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-15468

title: As a BOC user, I would like to upload the initial pool amounts for International Signing Bonuses
custom_steps:
**AC**
-Add an Import button to the International Signing Bonus Utility
-Upon clicking import, show a popup modal that has a year value (format will match the intl signing bonus period -> 2018-2019)
-For the year value - the current period will be the first value, we should go out 10 years.  It should default to the current period always.
-The spreadsheet used in the import should match the attached spreadsheet
-Show a warning upon clicking import saying that any original pool amounts will be replaced with values from the spreadsheet
-Upon import, we will remove original pool amounts for the given year and replace them with values from the spreadsheet.  
-Do not remove any non-original pool amount values if they have been entered
-Do not remove any individual intl bonuses if they have been entered

**Security**
-This will only be available for BOC users who have the following permission: *EBIS-INTL-SIGNING-BONUS-EDITORS*

title: As a federation user I want to see a warning if I attempt to register a player that might require a status check
custom_steps:
Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347695

Messages #8: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a federation user is attempting to create an international amateur player profile for a player that has a home country of Japan, Taiwan or South Korea should warn the user that a current status check might be required for the player. 
* Message #8 should display on "Save" from the profile or "Next" from the Create New.

title: As a BOC user I want to ebis to indicate in the Reg Admin widget whether or not a player has a potential match
custom_steps:
Wires: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration_admin

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Matches" column added to the Registration Admin widget after the Reg Status column.
* The "Matches" column will display the number of potential matches that the player has. 
* In order to achieve this, when the matching logic is run on a player profile create/update, it will need to set a flag indicating that a match exists. Players either are a match or are not, we are not doing percentage matches here still.

title: As a BOC user I want to review the potential matches in the Reg Admin widget
custom_steps:
Wires:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration_admin

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a user is viewing the Registration Admin widget, the Matches column contains an expansion icon. 
* Clicking the expansion icon will open the expansion to display the matches found.

title: As a BOC user I want to merge potential matches
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Users are able to check off the matches inside the "Matches" expansion and merge them with the master profile using the Merge button in the footer of the widget. 
* Clicking "Merge" will launch the merge workflow just as though two non-expansion rows have been selected.

title: As a BOC user I want to ignore a potential match
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* An "Ignore" button is available in the footer of the Registration Admin widget.
* Checking off any of the matches found in the widget will enable the Ignore button. 
* If a non-match row is checked off, the Ignore button will be disabled again. 
* Clicking "Ignore" will remove the selection from being a match to the profile it is currently associated with. If it is associated with more than one profile as a potential match - it remains a potential match for those profiles that the user has not clicked "Ignore" for.

title: As a user I want my MJC "Contract" attachment upload to have its filename set to a specific format
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* When an attachment is uploaded to a Major Contract with a file label of "Contract", the system should automatically adjust the filename of the file to meet the following format :ORG  Last Name, First Name (Start Year). For instance, SEA  LeBlanc, Wade (2019). 
* System needs to check if another file already exists with the same filename. If yes add a - 2 or -3 or whatever to differentiate.

title: As a user I want all historical MJC "Contract" attachment uploads to have its filename set to a specific format
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* In order to have historical attachments have the proper filename format for export, we need to update the MJ Contract "contract" attachments to have the proper filename. The filename of the file should meet the following format :ORG  Last Name, First Name (Start Year). For instance, SEA  LeBlanc, Wade (2019). 
* If a duplicate exists we need to account for that and not save the same file name twice. Add - 2 or -3 or whatever to differentiate.

title: As a user I want to receive a notification 5 days prior to a Player to be Named Later transaction being due if not yet completed
custom_steps:
Clipboard:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/MJA+Notifications

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Player to Be Named Later is due five days from the current date on an Outright Trade or Waiver Claim Assignment that has not yet been marked paid or approved, generate Notification #10 for Club and BOC MJ Transaction Admins. 
* A notification should only be generated for an outstanding PTBNL one time.
